title: Boomsville
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Film festivals - Germany - Oberhausen - Awards
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Film festivals - United States - New York - Awards
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/City planning - Social aspects
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Cities and towns - Growth - Social aspects
description: An amusing diagnosis of big city growing pains. This film is an ironic view of town planning or rather, the lack of it and what has happened to our cities as a result. Done in cartoon animation, the film traces the growth of the typical city, from a tiny settlement in the vast North American wilderness to the car-clogged metropolis that so many cities are today. Awards: New York; Oberhousen; Les Menuires.
